ProteinName	Splicing factor Cactin (Renal carcinoma antigen NY-REN-24)
GeneName	CACTIN C19orf29
Length	935
Function	Plays a role in pre-mRNA splicing by facilitating excision of a subset of introns (PubMed:28062851). Required for the splicing of CDCA5/Sororin, a regulator of sister chromatid cohesion (PubMed:28062851). Involved in the regulation of innate immune response (PubMed:20829348). Acts as a negative regulator of Toll-like receptor, interferon-regulatory factor (IRF) and canonical NF-kappa-B signaling pathways (PubMed:20829348, PubMed:26363554). Contributes to the regulation of transcriptional activation of NF-kappa-B target genes in response to endogenous pro-inflammatory stimuli (PubMed:20829348, PubMed:26363554).
Subcellular Location	Nucleus; Cytoplasm; Cytosol
